lines.text: [first lines]
[Mike and Phyllis are practicing making duck calls]
It's a good thing for you I'm not hunting ducks.
Yeah? What are you hunting?
A guy named Michael Shayne.
[Phyllis hangs up on potential client so Mike will go on his vacation instead]
It was just one of my boyfriends.
The one with teeth like a rabbit?
No, the one with the two heads.
Must we talk business right away? I've been sort of lonely.

[glances at Mayme's ashtray]
Mm-hmm. Do you always smoke cigars when you're lonely?
Well, I never get *that* lonely.
When Payson does call you, look me up before you go to Santa Rosita.
Why not.
And if you get lonesome some night, stop in at the Green Lantern and I'll sing you a lullaby.
Thanks, but I have my cat and my pipe.
Just a minute tall, dark and loathsome! Remember, I don't give any information *before* I get paid off.
Sister, the kind of game you're playing, you're a cinch to get paid off - plenty!
[Mike awakens after being shot to find the lovely Phyllis leaning over his bed]
Heaven, huh? I never thought I'd make it.
Shayne, I see you weren't injured too seriously, either.
No, as long as they shoot me in the head, I guess I'm all right. The bullets just glance off.
I have a hunch that one of you guys is a duck and the other a decoy. As soon as I know enough to call my shots, I'll be back for some answers.
Hey, Rafferty, this is for you.
[Boyle hands Rafferty a note from Mike]
Read it - if you can.
I'll bet you a kiss I'll be back before you are.
Oh, Mike, you know I don't approve of gambling.
Oh, it's no gamble - it's a sure thing!
You know, Boyle and I were about to wrap up this case, too, Shayne. After all, we weren't born yesterday.
Why, sure you boys weren't born yesterday - too nice a day.
[last lines]
[as Mike bends over to kiss Phyllis, his secretary lets out a blast on her duck call]
Now, that one had feeling!
Would it be askin' too much to let me in on your little secret, or do I have to beat it out of you with my own two hands?
Now, Pete, Mike's in no condition to argue.
Nooo. Mustn't be upset - doctor's orders.
Why don't you come back in the morning when you're more rested and your mind is clear.
At least you'll be rested, Pete.
